```{r}

  geom_col(position = 'stack', width = 1) +

        axis.ticks = element_blank()) +
  labs(fill = "House Ownership",

       y = NULL,
       title = "House Ownership") + 
  coord_polar("y")

```

```{r}
library(data.table)
library(ggplot2)
library(ggthemes)
library(glmnet)
library(dplyr)
theme_set(theme_bw())
```

```{r}
data <- dd

#REMOVE unwanted ID
data$Id <- NULL

#Change col names
colnames(data)[4] <- "Marital_Status"

str(data)
```
```{r}
summary(data)
```

---
Lasso Regression
---

```{r}
set.seed(123)
smp_size <- floor(0.70 * nrow(data))
train_ind <- sample(seq_len(nrow(data)), size = smp_size)

x_data <- model.matrix( ~ -1 + Income + Age +
 Experience + Marital_Status +
 House_Ownership + Car_Ownership +CURRENT_JOB_YRS + CURRENT_HOUSE_YRS, data)

# outcome is median house value in millions
y_data <- dd$Risk_Flag

x_train <- x_data[train_ind, ]
y_train <- y_data[train_ind]
x_test <- x_data[-train_ind, ]
y_test <- y_data[-train_ind]

```

```{r}

est <- cv.glmnet(x_train, y=y_train, alpha = 1, nfolds = 10)
best_lambda <- est$lambda.min

```


```{r}

best_model <- glmnet(x_train, y_train, alpha = 1, lambda = best_lambda)
coef(best_model)

```

```{r}

predictions_train <- predict(best_model, s = best_lambda, newx = x_train, family = binomial)
predicted_train_binary <- ifelse(predictions_train > 0.5, 1, 0)

predictions_test <- predict(best_model, s = best_lambda, newx = x_test, family = binomial)
predicted_test_binary <- ifelse(predictions_test > 0.5, 1, 0)


```
